org.netbeans.modules.refactoring.spi.ui

Class FiltersDescription

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.netbeans.modules.refactoring.spi.ui.FiltersDescription

  • public final class FiltersDescription
extends Object
    Since:
    1.29

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  FiltersDescription.Provider
      RefactoringPlugins can implement this interface if they want to supply new filters, or enable existing filters.

    • Constructor Summary

      FiltersDescription()
      Creates a new instance of FiltersDescription

    • Method Detail

      • addFilter

        public void addFilter(@NonNull
                      String key,
                      @NonNull
                      String tooltip,
                      boolean selected,
                      @NonNull
                      Icon icon)
        Add a new filter to the FiltersDescription. Filters are by default disabled. FiltersDescription.Providers should enable them when used.
        Parameters:
        key - identifier for the filter
        tooltip - text to display in the tooltip of the filter button
        selected - true if the filter should be selected
        icon - icon to use for the filter button

      • getFilterCount

        public int getFilterCount()
        Returns the number of filters in this description.
        Returns:
        the number of filters in this description

      • getKey

        @NonNull
public String getKey(int index)
        Returns the key of the filter at the supplied index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the filter
        Returns:
        the key
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size())

public String getTooltip(int index)

      • enable

        public void enable(int index)
        Enable the filter at the supplied index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the filter
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size())

      • enable

        public void enable(@NonNull
                   String key)
        Enable the filter with the supplied key. If there is no filter with the supplied key, nothing will change.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of a filter

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled(int index)
        Returns true if the filter at the supplied index is enabled.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the filter
        Returns:
        true if the filter is enabled.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size())
